topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Meltem previews an early-growth philosophy of nailing fundamentals before scaling. Lenny introduces the show, Meltem’s role at Deel, and what listeners will learn.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Miro and LMNT.

topics.title: Deel overview and growth trajectory stats
topics.summary: Meltem explains Deel’s product (global payroll/HR/compliance) and shares ARR milestones from under $1M to ~$295M while staying EBITDA positive. She also describes how early she joined and Deel’s headcount at the time.

topics.title: Cheap growth channels: communities and answering questions
topics.summary: Meltem explains why “cheap channels” often mean places people ask for help (Google/SEO, Reddit, Quora, communities) and how adding value beats selling. She details Deel’s Reddit keyword-monitoring approach and why audience size/intent matter.

topics.title: How to respond: value-first, never automated
topics.summary: They discuss what good community engagement looks like (answer fully, then mention your product) versus spammy replies. Meltem emphasizes human responses, internal participation (including founders), and expanding to Twitter and closed communities.

topics.title: SEO principles: end the search, not keyword stuffing
topics.summary: Meltem shares Deel’s SEO philosophy: write content that fully resolves the user’s query so they don’t bounce back to Google. Example: explaining Employer of Record (EOR) clearly, including limitations and downsides.

topics.title: SEO operations: traffic-light keyword framework and tooling
topics.summary: Meltem details Deel’s “traffic light” system for classifying up to ~700 keywords by intent (green/yellow/red) and prioritizing by volume. She covers search-intent checks, SERP research, related-questions mining, and tools like Clearscope for readability and on-page optimization.

topics.title: Content team structure and publishing cadence
topics.summary: Meltem describes an ~8-person content org with strong ops, freelancers, and domain-focused owners across product lines, plus newer formats like video/education. They publish ~10 pieces/week split between new articles and updates, and expand across languages.

topics.title: When SEO makes sense (and when it doesn’t)
topics.summary: Meltem argues SEO is best when people actively search for solutions (common in B2B), but less effective for many consumer goods where discovery happens via social/influencers. They discuss how intent and search behavior should drive channel choice.

topics.title: Early growth prioritization: fundamentals before paid
topics.summary: Meltem lays out a step-by-step early growth checklist: fast, understandable website; ensure discoverability via content; only then scale paid. She also warns against generic B2B copy and shares how Deel moved off a hard-coded site to enable rapid A/B testing.

topics.title: Paid growth expansion: long-tail channels and diversification
topics.summary: After covering major ad platforms, Deel invested in long-tail paid placements (review sites, newsletters, podcasts, niche sites) that individually are small but collectively meaningful. Meltem emphasizes diversification and the operational reality that small channels still require real setup effort.

topics.title: Why early B2B awareness campaigns often waste time
topics.summary: Meltem explains why she avoids early awareness campaigns in B2B: they’re slow, resource-intensive, and messaging is usually not yet proven. She contrasts this with later-stage brand reinforcement, citing Notion’s out-of-home ads as effective due to timing and recognizable product UI.

topics.title: Partnership strategy: trusted advisors vs audience overlap
topics.summary: Meltem distinguishes between partners with shared audiences and partners who are trusted sources for the specific decision. She highlights VCs as high-leverage partners because founders ask them for vendor recommendations when scaling hiring.

topics.title: Customer questions Deel answers: compliance, taxes, hiring specifics
topics.summary: They discuss the concrete, high-intent questions Deel fields (cross-border compliance and tax nuances by country and worker type). Meltem shares a prior example where a PPP resource became so authoritative it was linked by the IRS, illustrating the power of truly helpful content.

topics.title: Paid acquisition best practices: creative fatigue and true ROI
topics.summary: Meltem covers paid growth fundamentals: continuous creative refresh, aligning messaging with evolving product, and optimizing beyond lead volume to conversion and payback. Deel uses real-time dashboards to track funnel conversion and 1-year value by channel (e.g., Facebook) to guide spend.
